org.jlab.coda.xmsg.xsys.regdis

Class xMsgRegDiscDriver

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jlab.coda.xmsg.xsys.regdis.xMsgRegDiscDriver
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    xMsgRegistrar, xMsgRegRepT

    public class xMsgRegDiscDriver
extends java.lang.Object

    Class that provides methods for registration and discovery of xMsg actors, i.e. publishers and subscribers. This class contains a basic method used by all xMsg extending classes to create zmq socket for communications. This means that this class owns the zmq context. Constructor uses default registrar port: xMsgConstants.REGISTRAR_PORT todo: in the future this class may allow custom port number

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      xMsgRegDiscDriver(java.lang.String feHost)
      Constructor creates sockets to both front-end and local registration and discovery servers.

    • Constructor Detail

      • xMsgRegDiscDriver

        public xMsgRegDiscDriver(java.lang.String feHost)
                  throws xMsgException,
                         java.net.SocketException

        Constructor creates sockets to both front-end and local registration and discovery servers. Uses default port.

        Parameters:
        feHost - front-end host name
        Throws:
        xMsgException
        java.net.SocketException

    • Method Detail

      • __zmqSocket

        public static org.zeromq.ZMQ.Socket __zmqSocket(org.zeromq.ZContext context,
                                int socket_type,
                                java.lang.String h,
                                int port,
                                int boc)
                                         throws xMsgException

        Creates and returns zmq socket object

        Parameters:
        context - zmq context
        socket_type - the type of the socket (integer defined by zmq)
        h - host name
        port - port number
        boc - if set 0 socket will be bind, otherwise it will connect. Note that for xMsg proxies we always connect (boc = 1) (proxies are XPUB/XSUB sockets).
        Returns:
        zmq socket object
        Throws:
        xMsgException

      • getContext

        public org.zeromq.ZContext getContext()
        Returns the main zmq socket context
        Returns:
        zmq context

      • removeAllRegistration_fe

        public void removeAllRegistration_fe(java.lang.String host,
                            java.lang.String name)
                              throws xMsgRegistrationException

        Removes all xMsg actors (publishers and subscribers) registration from the front-end global registration and discovery database that were previously registered on a specified host local database. This method is usually called by the xMsgNode Registrar when it shuts down or gets interrupted.

        Parameters:
        host - host name of the xMsgNode
        name - the name of the sender
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • register_fe

        public void register_fe(java.lang.String name,
               xMsgR.xMsgRegistration data,
               boolean isPublisher)
                 throws xMsgRegistrationException

        Registers xMsg actor with the front-end registration and discovery server

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the requester/sender
        data - xMsgR.xMsgRegistration object
        isPublisher - if set to be true then this is a request to register a publisher, otherwise this is a subscriber registration request
        Throws:
        xMsgRegistrationException

      • findLocal

        public java.util.List<xMsgR.xMsgRegistration> findLocal(java.lang.String name,
                                               xMsgR.xMsgRegistration data,
                                               boolean isPublisher)
                                                 throws xMsgDiscoverException

        Searches the local registration and discovery databases for an actor that publishes or subscribes the topic of the interest. The search criteria i.e. topic is defined within the xMsgRegistration object.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the sender/requester
        data - xMsgR.xMsgRegistration object
        isPublisher - if set to be true then this is a request to find publishers, otherwise subscribers
        Returns:
        List of xMsgR.xMsgRegistration objects
        Throws:
        xMsgDiscoverException

      • findGlobal

        public java.util.List<xMsgR.xMsgRegistration> findGlobal(java.lang.String name,
                                                xMsgR.xMsgRegistration data,
                                                boolean isPublisher)
                                                  throws xMsgDiscoverException

        Searches the front-end registration and discovery databases for an actor that publishes or subscribes the topic of the interest. The search criteria i.e. topic is defined within the xMsgRegistration object.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the sender/requester
        data - xMsgR.xMsgRegistration object
        isPublisher - if set to be true then this is a request to find publishers, otherwise subscribers
        Returns:
        List of xMsgR.xMsgRegistration objects
        Throws:
        xMsgDiscoverException
